decl.description:
The furo-ui5-reference-search
 search a reference

 Bounded data must fullfill the  furo.reference signature. The service, deeplink,... is taken from the spec of your field.
 Do not forget to specify.

 *default usage*
```html
  <furo-ui5-reference-search
  ƒ-bind-data="--data(*.is_person)"
  ></furo-ui5-reference-search>
```

 *usage with a extended searcher*
```html
  <furo-ui5-reference-search
  extended-searcher="country-filter"
  ƒ-bind-data="--data(*.is_person)"
  ></furo-ui5-reference-search>
```

 *usage example for a non default response*
```html
  <furo-ui5-reference-search
  extended-searcher="contact-filter"
  search-response-path="xx_entities"
  value-field-path="data.xx_id"
  display-field-path="data.xx_display_name"
  ƒ-bind-data="--data(*.is_person)"
  ></furo-ui5-reference-search-labeled>
```

## supported meta and constraints
- **readonly: true** , set the element to readonly
- **placeholder:"some string"** set the placeholder for the element
- **max:"number"** set the maximum number of characters available in the input field.

The constraint **required** will mark the element as required

## Methods
**bind-data(fieldNode)**
Bind a entity field. This can be a scalar type or any complex type with 'id','display_name' signature.

If your type has a *reference* type signature ('id','display_name', 'link'), the service, and initial deep link is extracted from
the link part of your type.

If you bind a skalar field, the value which is set in 'valueFieldPath' will be set.

When you use @-object-ready from a furo-data-object which emits a EntityNode, just bind the field with --entity(*.fields.fieldname)

## Specs
Define a propper default value on the reference type.

```yaml
link:
type: furo.Link
description: HTS for the initial search (the default works on root resources only)
__proto:
   number: 3
__ui: null
meta:
  default: |
    {
         "rel": "list",
         "href": "/contacts",
         "method": "GET",
         "type": "contact.Contact",
         "service": "Contacts"
     }
  placeholder: ""
  hint: ""
  label: contact.Reference.link.label
  options:
    flags: []
    list: []
  readonly: false
  repeated: false
  typespecific: null

```
### API of a extended searcher
### Searcher Mehtods
The only method you have to implement is **htsIn**. The reference-search will pass its own hts to the extended
searcher. A call on qpIn on the searcher will also pass the resulting hts to the extended searcher.

### Searcher Events
Fire a **@-record-selected** to set the item on the reference-search.
Fire a **@-close-requested** to close the extended search.
decl.name: FuroUi5ReferenceSearch

cssProperties.description: background color of the result list
cssProperties.name: --furo-ui5-reference-search-list-background

members.name: onFnaFieldValueChanged
members.description: This is triggered from the FieldNodeAdapter when the data has changed

members.name: _updateField
members.description: This is used to update the FieldNodeAdapter

members.name: service
members.description: Set the service. This is only needed when you do not use a bind or bind a scalar value.

members.name: _closeList
members.description: Closes the list

members.name: _showList
members.description: Opens the list and selects the last selected item

members.name: onFnaPlaceholderChanged
members.description: Update the placeholder from the FNA

members.name: onFnaLabelChanged
members.description: Update the label from the FNA

members.name: onFnaReadonlyChanged
members.description: Updates the readonly state from FNA

members.name: onFnaConstraintsChanged
members.description: Updates the required constraint from the FNA

members.name: onFnaFieldNodeBecameInvalid
members.description: Updates the error state from FNA

members.name: onFnaFieldNodeBecameValid
members.description: Clears the error state from FNA

members.name: _setValueStateMessage
members.description: updater for the value state and message

members.name: _resetValueStateMessage
members.description: reset to previous value state

members.name: readAttributes
members.description:
Reads the attributes which are set on the component dom.

Following attributes can be set:
- `value-state`
- `value-state-message`
- `icon`
- `placeholder`
- `label`
- `required`
- `readonly`
- `disabled`

Use this after manual or scripted update of the attributes.

members.name: htsIn
members.description:
htsIn sets the HTS for the collection-agent.

This is only needed if you want to have fine grained control over the hts

members.name: qpIn
members.description: qpIn Use this to set query params manualy

members.name: setFilter
members.description:
Sets the filter.
Hint: use the FieldNode._base64 property to send complex objects as a filter and decode it on the server side
or do btoa(JSON.stringify(FILTER))

members.name: clearResultList
members.description: clears the result set

members.name: searchResponsePath
members.description:
Path to the node in the response value which contains the array with the selection items.
By default this goes to *entitites*

members.name: valueFieldPath
members.description:
Path to response value item which is used for the id.
By default this goes to *data.id*

members.name: displayFieldPath
members.description:
Path to selection value node which is used for the display.
By default this goes to *data.display_name*

members.name: extendedValueFieldPath
members.description:
Path to response value item of the exteded search which is used for the id.
By default this goes to *data.id*.
Only needed when your extended searcher does not have the id, display_name signature in the response.

members.name: extendedDisplayFieldPath
members.description:
Path to response value item of the exteded search which is used for the display.
By default this goes to *data.display_name*.
Only needed when your extended searcher does not have the id, display_name signature in the response.

members.name: maxItemsToDisplay
members.description:
The maximal number of items to display.

This value will be set as page-size query-param for the backend.

If the response contains hts information with rel *next* a "load more" button will be displayed at the end
of the list.

members.name: minTermLength
members.description: The minimal length of search term to trigger a search.

members.name: debounceTimeout
members.description: wait for this time between keystrokes to trigger a search to the service

members.name: placeholder
members.description:
Overrides the hint text from the **specs**.

Use with caution, normally the specs defines this value.

members.name: label
members.description:
Overrides the label text from the **specs**.

Use with caution, normally the specs defines this value.

members.name: noDataText
members.description: hint text when result not found by search

members.name: disableSearchList
members.description:
A Boolean attribute which, if present, means this field can not be searched.

This is very useful when you want enforce the usage of the extended search

members.name: icon
members.description: Use this attribute to set a custom icon for your searcher

members.name: _attributesFromFNA
_privilegedAttributes
members.default:
{
      readonly: null,
      placeholder: null,
      label: null,
      required: null,
      disabled: null,
      icon: null,
    }

members.name: required
members.description:
Overrides the required value from the **specs**.

Use with caution, normally the specs defines this value.

members.name: searchOnEnterOnly
members.description:
Enable this, to avoid the automatic triggering of "search".

The user have to press enter to trigger the search. Min-term-length is respected.

members.name: readonly
members.description:
Overrides the readonly value from the **specs**.

Use with caution, normally the specs defines this value.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disable

members.name: busy
members.description: This is used to activate the loading indicator.

members.name: extendedSearcher
members.description: Define the extended searcher. Do not forget to import the searcher you want to use.

events.description: Fired when a item was selected from the list.
events.name: item-selected

events.description: Fired when the input operation has finished by pressing Enter or on focusout.
events.name: change

events.description: Fired when the value of the ui5-input changes at each keystroke, and when a suggestion item has been selected.
events.name: input
